problem: On Tuesday, I worked $t+1$ hours and earned $3t-3$ dollars per hour. My friend Andrew worked $3t-5$ hours but only earned $t+2$ dollars an hour. At the end of the day, I had earned two dollars more than he had. What is the value of $t$?
solution: Since I earned two dollars more than Andrew, we know that $$(t+1) (3t-3) = (3t-5)(t+2) + 2 \qquad\Rightarrow\qquad 3t^2-3 = 3t^2 + t -8 .$$Simplifying gives $t = \boxed{5}$.
model_solution:
Step 1: Write an equation representing the difference between the total earnings of the two people.
\[(t+1)(3t-3)-(3t-5)(t+2)=2\]
Step 2: Expand the equation to get rid of the parentheses.
\[3t^{2}-3t+3t-3-(3t^{2}+6t-5t-10)=2\]
Step 3: Combine like terms to simplify the equation.
\[3t^{2}-3t+3t-3-3t^{2}-6t+5t+10=2\]
Step 4: 
\[-6t+5t+3t-3+10=2\]
Step 4: Simplify the equation.
\[-t+7=2\]
Step 5: 
\[-t+7=2 \Rightarrow -t=2-7 \Rightarrow -t=-5 \Rightarrow t=5\]
Step 5: 
\[-t=-5 \Rightarrow t=5\]
\(-t=-5\)
\(-t=-5 \Rightarrow t=5\)
\(-t=-5 \Rightarrow t=5\)

full_steps:
Step 1: Write an equation representing the difference between the total earnings of the two people.
\[(t+1)(3t-3)-(3t-5)(t+2)=2\]

Step 2: Expand the equation to get rid of the parentheses.
\[3t^{2}-3t+3t-3-(3t^{2}+6t-5t-10)=2\]

Step 3: Combine like terms to simplify the equation.
\[3t^{2}-3t+3t-3-3t^{2}-6t+5t+10=2\]
